author: Auguste Escoffier
method: Peel and mince the mushrooms. Heat the butter and the olive oil in a vegetable-pan. Add the mushrooms and fry until they are slightly browned. Now add the minced shallots, and immediately remove half the butter. Pour white wine and liqueur brandy into the stewpan; reduce this liquid to half, and finish the sauce with the half-glaze, tomato sauce and the meat-glaze.  Set to boil for five minutes more, and complete with the chopped parsley.
ingredients: 6 medium-sized mushrooms,  15g/½oz butter,  15g/½oz olive oil,  coffeespoon minced shallots,  290ml/½ pint white wine,  1 glass brandy,  290ml/½ pint half-glaze,  150ml/¼pt tomato sauce,  1 tbsp meat-glaze,  1 tsp chopped parsley
